definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: The slightly blurred quality of his photography attains an aesthetic sensibility closer to painting;
sentences.chinese: 他稍稍发虚的摄影给人一种绘画感。

sentences.english: What I have is a hollow feeling in my stomach the size of a coconut.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉胃里发虚，好像那里有了一个椰子般大小的洞。

sentences.english: Cattle victory cant remember the night before, the in the mind straight hair.
sentences.chinese: 牛胜利记不清前一晚的事，心里直发虚。

definition: to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
variant of 發怵|发怵[fa1 chu4]
to weaken/to go soft (at the knees)
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
